sourcing.instructions:
P (Polymer) - Available at local chemical supply stores or online. 
 m (Metallic Powder) - Obtainable from metal supply shops or online retailers. 
 T (Thermal Stabilizer) - Can be purchased from specialty chemical suppliers. 
 c (Curing Agent) - Available from resin or adhesive suppliers.
steps: P (Polymer) - Available at local chemical supply stores or online.
m (Metallic Powder) - Obtainable from metal supply shops or online retailers.
T (Thermal Stabilizer) - Can be purchased from specialty chemical suppliers.
c (Curing Agent) - Available from resin or adhesive suppliers.
1. Weigh out 600 g of P (Polymer) and place it in a mixing bowl.
2. Add 300 g of m (Metallic Powder) to the same bowl.
3. Gradually mix the ingredients together until fully combined, ensuring uniform distribution.
4. Weigh 200 g of T (Thermal Stabilizer) and incorporate it into the mixture.
5. Finally, weigh 100 g of c (Curing Agent) and mix thoroughly to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 600 g of P (Polymer) and place it in a mixing bowl. 
 2. Add 300 g of m (Metallic Powder) to the same bowl. 
 3. Gradually mix the ingredients together until fully combined, ensuring uniform distribution. 
 4. Weigh 200 g of T (Thermal Stabilizer) and incorporate it into the mixture. 
 5. Finally, weigh 100 g of c (Curing Agent) and mix thoroughly to ensure even distribution.

steps: Transfer the mixture into a mold of dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
Bake in the oven for 1 hour.
heating.raw_text:
Preheat the oven to 150°C (302°F). 
 Transfer the mixture into a mold of dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 
 Bake in the oven for 1 hour.

steps: After baking, turn off the oven and allow the material to cool inside for 30 minutes.
Then, remove from the oven and let it cool at room temperature for an additional 2 hours.
cooling.raw_text:
After baking, turn off the oven and allow the material to cool inside for 30 minutes. 
 Then, remove from the oven and let it cool at room temperature for an additional 2 hours.

steps: Once cooled, demold the solid sample carefully.
Use fine-grit sandpaper (220 grit) to smooth any rough edges.
Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability, following the manufacturer’s instructions for application.
post_processing.raw_text:
Once cooled, demold the solid sample carefully. 
 Use fine-grit sandpaper (220 grit) to smooth any rough edges. 
 Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability, following the manufacturer’s instructions for application.
